items.title: Erev Pesach
items.memo: Passover, the Feast of Unleavened Bread. Also called Chag HaMatzot (the Festival of Matzah), it commemorates the Exodus and freedom of the Israelites from ancient Egypt

items.title: Yom HaShoah
items.memo: Holocaust Memorial Day

items.title: Yom HaZikaron
items.memo: Israeli Memorial Day. Note that Hebcal displays modern holidays like Yom HaZikaron according to the Israeli schedule. Although Yom Hazikaron is normally observed on the 4th of Iyyar, it may be moved earlier or postponed if observance of the holiday (or Yom HaAtzma'ut, which always follows it) would conflict with Shabbat

items.title: Yom HaAtzma'ut
items.memo: Israeli Independence Day. Commemorates the declaration of independence of Israel in 1948. Note that Hebcal displays modern holidays like Yom HaAtzma'ut according to the Israeli schedule. Although Yom HaAtzma'ut is normally observed on the 5th of Iyyar, it may be moved earlier or postponed if observance of the holiday (or Yom HaZikaron, which always precedes it) would conflict with Shabbat

items.title: Pesach Sheni
items.memo: Second Passover, one month after Passover

items.title: Lag BaOmer
items.memo: 33rd day of counting the Omer

items.title: Yom Yerushalayim
items.memo: Jerusalem Day. Commemorates the re-unification of Jerusalem in 1967

items.memo: Festival of Weeks. Commemorates the giving of the Torah at Mount Sinai

items.title: Tzom Tammuz
items.memo: Fast commemorating breaching of the walls of Jerusalem before the destruction of the Second Temple

items.memo: Shabbat before Tish'a B'Av (Shabbat of Prophecy/Shabbat of Vision)

items.title: Erev Tish'a B'Av
items.memo: The Ninth of Av. Fast commemorating the destruction of the two Temples

items.title: Tish'a B'Av
items.memo: The Ninth of Av. Fast commemorating the destruction of the two Temples

items.title: Tu B'Av
items.memo: Minor Jewish holiday of love. Observed on the 15th day of the Hebrew month of Av

items.title: Shabbat Nachamu
items.memo: Shabbat after Tish'a B'Av (Shabbat of Consolation). The first of seven Shabbatot leading up to Rosh Hashanah. Named after the Haftarah (from Isaiah 40) which begins with the verse נַחֲמוּ נַחֲמוּ, עַמִּי ("Comfort, oh comfort my people")

items.title: Leil Selichot
items.memo: Prayers for forgiveness in preparation for the High Holidays

items.memo: The Jewish New Year. Also spelled Rosh Hashanah

items.memo: Fast of the Seventh Month. Commemorates the assassination of the Jewish governor of Judah

items.memo: Shabbat that falls between Rosh Hashanah and Yom Kippur (Shabbat of Returning)
